plugin.name: Rat::Plugin4Maven
plugin.description: A plugin for Apache Maven that runs Apache Rat to audit the source to be distributed.

mojo.description: Run Rat to perform a violation check.

parameter.name: addDefaultLicenseMatchers
parameter.description: Whether to add the default list of license matchers.

parameter.name: addLicenseHeaders
parameter.description: Whether to add license headers; possible values are forced, true, and false (default).

parameter.name: basedir
parameter.description: The base directory, in which to search for files.

parameter.name: copyrightMessage
parameter.description: Copyright message to add to license headers. This option is ignored, unless addLicenseHeaders is set to true, or forced.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Specifies files, which are excluded in the report. By default, no files are excluded.

parameter.name: excludeSubProjects
parameter.description: Whether to exclude subprojects. This is recommended, if you want a separate apache-rat-plugin report for each subproject.

parameter.name: ignoreErrors
parameter.description: Will ignore rat errors and display a log message if any. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Specifies files, which are included in the report. By default, all files are included.

parameter.name: licenseFamilies
parameter.description: Specifies the license families to accept.

parameter.name: licenseMatchers
parameter.description: Specifies the licenses to accept. Deprecated, use licenses instead.

parameter.name: licenses
parameter.description: Specifies the licenses to accept. By default, these are added to the default licenses, unless you set addDefaultLicenseMatchers to true.

parameter.name: numUnapprovedLicenses
parameter.description: Maximum number of files with unapproved licenses.

parameter.name: reportFile
parameter.description: Where to store the report.

parameter.name: reportStyle
parameter.description: Output style of the report. Use 'plain' (the default) for a plain text report or 'xml' for the raw XML report. Alternatively you can give the path of an XSL transformation that will be applied on the raw XML to produce the report written to the output file.

parameter.name: useDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the default excludes when scanning for files. The default excludes are: - meta data files for version control systems - temporary files used by Maven, see useMavenDefaultExcludes - configuration files for Eclipse, see useEclipseDefaultExcludes - configuration files for IDEA, see useIdeaDefaultExcludes

parameter.name: useEclipseDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the Eclipse specific default excludes when scanning for files. Eclipse specific default excludes are given by the constant ECLIPSE_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The .classpath and .project files, the .settings directory, and so on.

parameter.name: useIdeaDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the IDEA specific default excludes when scanning for files. IDEA specific default excludes are given by the constant IDEA_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The *.iml, *.ipr and *.iws files and the .idea directory.

parameter.name: useMavenDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the Maven specific default excludes when scanning for files. Maven specific default excludes are given by the constant MAVEN_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The target directory, the cobertura.ser file, and so on.

mojo.description: Display help information on apache-rat-plugin. Call mvn apache-rat:help -Ddetail=true -Dgoal=<goal-name> to display parameter details.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: If true, display all settable properties for each goal.

parameter.name: goal
parameter.description: The name of the goal for which to show help. If unspecified, all goals will be displayed.

parameter.name: indentSize
parameter.description: The number of spaces per indentation level, should be positive.

parameter.name: lineLength
parameter.description: The maximum length of a display line, should be positive.

mojo.description: Generates a report with Rat's output.

parameter.name: addDefaultLicenseMatchers
parameter.description: Whether to add the default list of license matchers.

parameter.name: basedir
parameter.description: The base directory, in which to search for files.

parameter.name: excludes
parameter.description: Specifies files, which are excluded in the report. By default, no files are excluded.

parameter.name: excludeSubProjects
parameter.description: Whether to exclude subprojects. This is recommended, if you want a separate apache-rat-plugin report for each subproject.

parameter.name: includes
parameter.description: Specifies files, which are included in the report. By default, all files are included.

parameter.name: licenseFamilies
parameter.description: Specifies the license families to accept.

parameter.name: licenseMatchers
parameter.description: Specifies the licenses to accept. Deprecated, use licenses instead.

parameter.name: licenses
parameter.description: Specifies the licenses to accept. By default, these are added to the default licenses, unless you set addDefaultLicenseMatchers to true.

parameter.name: outputDirectory
parameter.description: Specifies the directory where the report will be generated

parameter.name: useDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the default excludes when scanning for files. The default excludes are: - meta data files for version control systems - temporary files used by Maven, see useMavenDefaultExcludes - configuration files for Eclipse, see useEclipseDefaultExcludes - configuration files for IDEA, see useIdeaDefaultExcludes

parameter.name: useEclipseDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the Eclipse specific default excludes when scanning for files. Eclipse specific default excludes are given by the constant ECLIPSE_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The .classpath and .project files, the .settings directory, and so on.

parameter.name: useIdeaDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the IDEA specific default excludes when scanning for files. IDEA specific default excludes are given by the constant IDEA_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The *.iml, *.ipr and *.iws files and the .idea directory.

parameter.name: useMavenDefaultExcludes
parameter.description: Whether to use the Maven specific default excludes when scanning for files. Maven specific default excludes are given by the constant MAVEN_DEFAULT_EXCLUDES: The target directory, the cobertura.ser file, and so on.
